title: A dissent to safeguard the future
description: The dissent from the lone woman Supreme Court judge on the elevation of Justice Pancholi is multi-faceted. It did not merely focus on the point that there were other senior women High Court judges. Her reservations touched upon the criteria the Collegium had to consider while assessing a candidate for elevation

description: Alexander Isak has moved to Liverpool from Newcastle United for a record fee. The Swedish striker's transfer is now the most expensive in British soccer history. Isak expressed his happiness to join Liverpool. Newcastle has signed Nick Woltemade and Yoane Wissa as replacements. Liverpool's acquisition of Isak is part of their summer spending.

Designing dignity: how public spaces can transform elderly lives
description: Accessibility for the elderly in public spaces is not just a matter of infrastructure — it is a measure of a society’s empathy and foresight. As India ages rapidly, our cities, institutions, and services must be redesigned to include — not exclude — our elders

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
description: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Coforge and BlueStar. Coforge, trading between Rs 1760-1770, shows a flag pattern breakout, targeting Rs 1880. Similarly, BlueStar, in the Rs 1945-1955 range, also exhibits a bullish flag pattern, aiming for Rs 2100, with positive momentum indicators supporting the uptrend for both stocks.

title: Why a remote Kutch village could end up as a test bed for Mars mission
T20I Tri-Series: Rashid Khan scripts history; Creates unforgettable record
description: Rashid Khan etched his name in T20I history, becoming the highest wicket-taker as Afghanistan defeated UAE by 38 runs. Khan's 3/21 restricted UAE to 150/8, surpassing Tim Southee's record. Afghanistan posted 188/4, fueled by Ibrahim Zadran's 63 and Sediqullah Atal's 54. Despite Muhammad Waseem's 67, UAE faltered. This victory marks Afghanistan's comeback in the tri-series after losing to Pakistan.

title: Tianjin Summit: There are no ideal relationships, especially between major powers
UP adds new tourist spot to Mahabharat circuit: Kampil, ‘linked to Draupadi’

UP: Youth killed, body in Ganga; police cite relationship with friend’s sister
description: Kanpur police have solved the murder case of 22-year-old Rishikesh, whose torso was found in the Ganga. Four suspects are arrested, while four remain at large. Rishikesh was killed for having a relationship with the sister of prime suspect Pawan, who threatened him before the murder.

title: Large-scale conversion racket busted, 4 arrested: Bareilly police
Belgium to recognise Palestinian state at U.N. General Assembly
description: "Palestine will be recognised by Belgium at the U.N. session! And firm sanctions are being imposed against the Israeli government," Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot wrote on X.

description: The 25-year-old Swedish forward scored 27 times in 42 appearances in all competitions for Newcastle last season; Liverpool’s spending on new signings comes to an estimated £416 million in the summer

title: Higher rate of cancer among women; oral cancer most common type in men: How the 4-year cancer registry maps incidence
Delhi-NCR rains: Thousands stuck in massive Gurgaon traffic snarl; watch video
description: Gurgaon faced severe traffic disruptions on Monday due to waterlogged roads and numerous vehicle breakdowns. Commuters experienced extensive delays, particularly on the Delhi-Jaipur Expressway and key intersections. The traffic police responded to around 200 distress calls, deploying personnel and cranes to manage the chaos.

Yamuna nears danger mark: Delhi braces for floods; CM says ‘situation under control’
description: Delhi is on high alert as the Yamuna River is expected to surpass the danger mark, potentially leading to floods. Evacuations are underway in low-lying areas like Yamuna Bazar and Mayur Vihar, with authorities setting up camps and providing food.

title: Mitchell Starc bids farewell to T20Is; eyes long Test and ODI journey ahead
description: Mitchell Starc has retired from T20 Internationals to prioritize Test and ODI cricket, finishing as Australia's second-highest T20I wicket-taker. He aims to stay fresh for upcoming Indian Test tour, Ashes, and 2027 ODI World Cup. Australia named their squad for the T20 series against New Zealand, with Ben Dwarshuis joining the pace attack.

title: Express view on SCO summit: India should not overestimate possibilities with China and underestimate those with US
Dwayne Johnson weight loss: ‘Secret’ behind massive transformation
description: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson surprised everyone at the Venice Film Festival with a noticeably leaner physique, sparking widespread reactions. This transformation, reportedly a 60-pound weight loss, is for his role as Mark Kerr in 'The Smashing Machine.' Johnson attributes the change to digestive health issues and a desire to authentically portray the character, dismissing Ozempic rumors.

description: Response to the crisis has been hampered by the shrinking of funding for Afghanistan, led by U.S. aid cuts

title: Watch: Gambhir gives Kohli a brand new tag; surprises fans at DPL 2025 final
description: Gautam Gambhir was celebrated at the DPL 2025 final, where he playfully tagged cricketers with fitting descriptions. West Delhi Lions, led by Nitish Rana's unbeaten 79, clinched the title by defeating Central Delhi Kings. Rana's consistent performance throughout the playoffs and Gambhir's presence added excitement to the event.

title: Amid Maratha protest, BMC deploys more workers, forms war room
New mileston: UPI tops 2,000 crore monthly transactions; daily average at 64.5 crore
description: UPI achieved a new peak in August 2025, processing over 2,001 crore transactions worth Rs 24.85 lakh crore, marking a milestone. This reflects a 34% year-on-year volume increase, although the total value saw a slight dip from July. Daily averages reached 64.5 crore transactions, valued at Rs 80,177 crore, highlighting UPI's continued growth since its 2016 launch by NPCI.

description: Labour minister and district-in-charge minister for Dharwad on Monday spent the entire day visiting affected villages in his constituency (Kalaghatagi) where crops have been damaged by wild animals and held ‘Jana Spandana’ grievances redressal meeting in Kalaghatagi town.

Labour Day in US: Protests rock multiple cities; crowds take aim at Trump’s policies
description: Across the United States on Labor Day, protesters rallied against president Trump's policies in cities like New York, Chicago, and Washington DC. Demonstrations focused on issues such as immigrant rights, low wages, and concerns over potential National Guard deployments. The gatherings, organised by labour groups and activists, echoed previous protests against Trump's administration.

description: Amnesty said it documented the “deliberate shooting and killing” of 46 Druze in Sweida city or on its outskirts on July 15 and 16

title: What is a tree? Delhi Forest dept clarifies in circular

'Param Sundari' box office collection: Movie sees a drop on Monday; crosses Rs 30cr mark
description: ‘Param Sundari,’ starring Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra, had a strong opening weekend, grossing over Rs 26 crore. However, the rom-com experienced a significant drop on Monday, with collections falling to Rs 3.50 crore. Despite the dip, the film has surpassed Rs 30 crore in India and outperformed several of Janhvi's previous films, making it a notable success.

title: Jordan Hudson: Partner of North Carolina coach Bill Belichick makes UNC debut
description: Bill Belichick's college football debut with UNC is shadowed by attention on his personal life, particularly his relationship with Jordan Hudson. Her presence, along with sightings of his former partner Linda Holliday, adds to the off-field narratives. Despite the buzz, the focus remains on Belichick's adaptation to college football's unique challenges.

title: 2020 Delhi riots larger conspiracy: High Court set to announce verdict in bail pleas of 10 accused today

description: “Why are BRS leaders, who claim they have done no wrong, so afraid of a CBI probe? If they are innocent, they should face the investigation,” Mahesh Goud said

title: Benami properties from Delhi to UP, illegal assets worth over Rs 15 cr: Police on ops run by ‘Drug Queen’ in Northeast Delhi
Bihar voter roll: EC allows claims post-Sept 1; SC raps parties for few inclusions
description: The Supreme Court declined to extend the September 1 deadline for Bihar's draft voter list claims, as the Election Commission assured submissions are accepted until the nomination deadline. The court expressed concern over the low number of objections from political parties despite directives. It directed legal services to aid citizens with enrollment, noting individual electors were more proactive.

title: Geographers uncover why some rivers stay single while others split
description: Single-thread and multi-thread rivers feature different flood and erosion risks, ecosystem services, and water resources. These attributes are becoming more relevant as people cope with more powerful water weather events. As a result, the physical mechanism that dictates threading has been becoming a more important research focus

title: 'Fueling Russian war machine': Bessent's 'bad actors' jibe at India, China; dubs SCO meet 'performative'
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent voiced optimism about resolving trade tensions with India, saying, “two great countries will get this solved.” He dismissed the SCO summit as “largely performative,” despite PM Modi meeting Putin and Xi. Bessent criticized India’s Russian oil trade, while confirming Trump may impose more sanctions on Russia, stating, “everything’s on the table.”

title: Fifty years ago | China’s recognition of Bangla a ‘hopeful move’
‘He didn’t. She did’: Gisele fumes over Brady’s ‘great dad’ claim
description: Tom Brady's newsletter about fatherhood reportedly reignited tensions with Gisele Bündchen post-divorce. Bündchen felt Brady perpetuated a narrative of sacrifice she didn't agree with, leading to strained co-parenting. Their interactions are now limited to logistical matters concerning their children. Meanwhile, Bündchen has embraced a new chapter, welcoming a child with Joaquim Valente and focusing on peace and stability.

title: Athlete run over by dump truck: Surat councillor demands action against civic body officials, agency that hired ‘inexperienced’ driver
A hundred years ago | Indians in Australia
description: From the issue dated September 1, 1925 as there was no issue dated September 2, 1925

title: Why are minority institutions left out of RTE, asks SC
description: The Supreme Court has expressed serious reservations about its 2014 verdict, which exempted minority educational institutions from the Right to Education (RTE) Act. The court fears this exemption undermines universal elementary education and inclusivity.

description: The bail pleas by other co-accused, including Khalid Saifi, Gulfisha Fatima, have been pending in the High Court since 2022 and were heard by different Benches from time to time

title: India's squad for AFC U23 Asian Cup qualifiers announced
description: India are in Group H where they will play Bahrain (September 3), hosts Qatar (September 6), and Brunei Darussalam (September 9)

title: Ten Hag sacked by Leverkusen after two league games in charge
description: Leverkusen lost their opening league game 2-1 at home to Hoffenheim to put Ten Hag immediately under pressure, and their latest 3-3 draw against 10-man Bremen brings an end to his short reign at the club

title: 'Upper caste firms profiting from Russian oil': Udit Raj backs Navarro; row intensifies
description: Congress leader Udit Raj endorsed Peter Navarro's controversial remarks about Brahmins, sparking outrage. He claimed upper castes dominate Indian oil refining and benefit from cheap Russian oil, aligning with his party's focus on non-upper caste coalitions. Karti Chidambaram referenced 'Boston Brahmins' as societal elites, highlighting the complex intersection of caste, politics, and discrimination.

title: Duties of a householder
Dhankhar vacates VP Enclave, shifts to Abhay Chautala's farmhouse
description: Jagdeep Dhankhar, the former vice-president, has vacated VP Enclave and temporarily moved to a farmhouse in Chhatarpur owned by INLD chief Abhay Chautala, citing old family ties. The VP Enclave will be prepared for Dhankhar's successor, while the process to identify a retirement home for Dhankhar is underway, involving shortlisting and renovation of a suitable bungalow.

title: Rain, landslides batter Himachal, 5 more killed; monsoon toll over 300
description: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh triggered landslides, resulting in at least five fatalities and widespread disruption. Over 1,200 roads are blocked, including key highways, and power and water supplies are severely affected. The state has recorded its highest rainfall in August since 1949, exacerbating the challenges faced by residents and rescue efforts.

title: Isak reports to Liverpool for medical as transfer appears near completion
description: Isak arrived at Liverpool for his medical on Monday morning, hours after Sky Sports and The Athletic reported that Newcastle had given in to the striker’s wishes to leave

title: 'Thousands still trapped under rubble': Eyewitnesses describe Afghanistan earthquake horror
description: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, resulting in at least 812 fatalities and nearly 3,000 injuries. Entire villages were flattened, leaving thousands trapped and survivors recounting scenes of chaos and devastation. Rescue efforts are hampered by blocked roads and the remoteness of affected areas, while international aid begins to arrive to support the victims.

title: Tennis Premier League to be held in Ahmedabad from December 9 to 14
description: It is for the first time that the competition will be held outside Maharashtra

title: Medvedev splits with coach Cervara after eight-year partnership
Nestle sacks CEO over ‘undisclosed romantic relationship’ in office
description: “The departure of Laurent Freixe follows an investigation into an undisclosed romantic relationship with a direct subordinate which breached Nestle’s code of business conduct,” a statement from Nestle said

title: Shah tours flood-hit Jammu, assures assistance from Centre
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah assessed flood damage in Jammu, assuring full central support and prompt relief efforts. He highlighted the crucial role of the Army and security forces in rescue operations. An immediate allocation of ₹209 crore was made to the SDRF, with further assessment and assistance forthcoming after MHA surveys. Vaishno Devi pilgrimage remains suspended due to weather.

title: Olympic champion Imane Khelif fights World Boxing’s genetic sex testing rule
description: Khelif was bidding to compete in the world boxing championships which start on Thursday, but the CAS said that it dismissed a request to suspend the World Boxing decision until the case was heard

title: WWE RAW Results: Kabuki Warriors stun Judgment Day duo; Dominik defends IC title vs Styles
description: Monday Night RAW after Clash in Paris saw Jey Uso confronting The Vision crew, leading to a tag team match where he partnered with LA Knight against Bron Breakker and Bronson Reed. The Kabuki Warriors defeated The Judgment Day, while Finn Balor triumphed over Dragon Lee.

title: Amid tariff tensions, US & India kick off largest-ever Army exercise in Alaska
description: Despite tariff tensions, India and the US commenced the 'Yudh Abhyas' Army exercise in Alaska. Planning is underway for the Malabar naval exercise with Quad nations off Guam. Defence cooperation remains strong, with ongoing deliveries of GE engines and a future deal for MQ-9B drones, highlighting the enduring strategic partnership.

title: Gritty India lose 0-3 to Iran in CAFA Nations Cup
description: India fought hard for most part of the match but let in two goals in the last seven minutes

title: Aliens illegally entering India to face 5 years' jail & fine up to Rs 5 lakh
description: India's new Immigration & Foreigners Act, 2025, effective September 1, consolidates four existing laws. Entering India without valid documents now carries a penalty of up to five years' imprisonment and a Rs 5 lakh fine. Forged documents lead to harsher penalties. Educational and medical institutions must report foreign nationals' details.

title: Trump says he’s awarding former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom
description: Mr. Trump called Mr. Giuliani the “greatest Mayor in the history of New York City, and an equally great American Patriot”

title: Tripura Minister labels news media as an obstacle for Panchayat representatives
description: The Minister urged the Panchayat representatives to dedicate some time for the organisational activities of the BJP alongside their regular work

title: Urdu Academy defers Javed Akhtar event after protests
description: The West Bengal Urdu Academy postponed a poetry symposium featuring Javed Akhtar after religious groups protested his invitation, citing that his comments hurt their sentiments. While the Academy cited "unavoidable circumstances," critics suggest yielding to pressure. Akhtar stated he receives criticism from both Hindu and Muslim organizations and remains undeterred, hoping to visit Kolkata soon.

title: Clean Mumbai, free occupied areas by noon today, HC orders Jarange
description: The Bombay High Court has directed Maratha quota protesters, led by Jarange, to clear Mumbai's streets by noon, following petitions citing disruptions to city life and violations of fundamental rights. The court's special bench urged Jarange to ensure protesters vacate public spaces, allowing peaceful demonstrations at designated locations after fresh permissions are obtained.

title: Rethinking carbon pricing and taxes
description: In an era of rising tariff and non-tariff barriers, we cannot risk fragmented carbon pricing turning into massive compliance costs

title: Delhi Confidential: In attendance
Army contingent departs for India-U.S. joint military exercise ‘Yudh Abhyas 2025’ in Alaska
description: The Indian contingent, comprising troops from a battalion of the Madras Regiment, will train alongside soldiers of the 1st Battalion, 5th Infantry Regiment “Bobcats”, part of the Arctic Wolves Brigade Combat Team of the U.S. Army’s 11th Airborne Division

title: The Rock’s drastic weight loss leaves WWE comeback in serious doubt
description: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson surprises fans with a thinner look at the Venice Film Festival. This transformation is for his role as Mark Kerr in 'The Smashing Machine'. Johnson lost about 60 pounds through diet and workout. Fans react with amusement and concern. Johnson aims to showcase a broader acting range. Prosthetics are used for his transformation into Kerr.

title: Wedding bells for Haliburton? Fiancée Jade teases venue; fans flood Instagram with love
description: Jade Jones, fiancée of NBA star Tyrese Haliburton, has ignited wedding speculation by sharing glimpses of her dress and venue selection on social media. The couple, engaged since July 2025 after dating for six years, met at Iowa State University. Jones' recent posts, including a photo in a white dress and a venue reveal, hint at their upcoming nuptials.

title: Woman found dead in Kozhikode, friend in custody
Heavy rain lashes parts of Bhadradri Kothagudem district; 16 gates of Taliperu reservoir lifted
description: According to sources, a low-level causeway near Vagoddugudem village was flooded, cutting off road links to more than a dozen villages for several hours.

description: There is no gender-sensitive infrastructure for drug users in J&K

CM Revanth Reddy raps officials, orders faster restoration of rain-hit infrastructure
description: CM unhappy over complacency of officials over utilisation of SDRF funds

title: Rajasthan Assembly’s Monsoon Session starts with uproarious scenes
description: As soon as the House assembled, the Congress members started shouting slogans and displayed placards against vote theft allegations

title: Moment marketing: Indian firms ride Trump's tariff wave; witty ads target US rivals
description: Fueled by Trump's tariffs, a 'swadeshi' wave sweeps India, with brands like Amul and Dabur championing local products through patriotic campaigns. While some experts see it as opportunism, others believe it resonates in smaller towns. Despite the sentiment, consumers prioritize value, questioning if nationalism alone can drive purchasing decisions as brands strategically tap into the 'vocal for local' trend.

title: J&K’s Kishtwar highly vulnerable to glacial lake bursts: report
description: Key public infrastructure including roads, schools and government buildings were at risk, the report highlighted; the district has the highest number of glacial lakes in the Union Territory.

title: Man consumes herbicide after police ‘brutality’ in Gujarat’s Dwarka, two cops suspended after he dies 10 days later in hospital
Aadhaar can't be standalone proof of citizenship, says SC
description: The Supreme Court has declined to direct the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar as sole proof of citizenship for Bihar voter list enrollment, emphasizing its legal limitations. Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi reiterated that Aadhaar remains an identity document, not a citizenship proof, aligning with the Aadhaar Act and the Puttaswamy judgment.

title: PM Modi's China visit: SCO slams Pahalgam; India objects to BRI, which passes through POK
description: At the SCO summit, PM Modi condemned terrorism, highlighting the Pahalgam attack and urging members to avoid double standards. He emphasized security, connectivity respecting sovereignty, and opportunity through cooperation. India did not endorse China's BRI due to the CPEC. Modi advocated for UN reforms and proposed a Civilizational Dialogue Forum to strengthen ties, underscoring India's active role in the SCO.

title: Netanyahu reportedly refused IDF Chief Eyal Zamir’s call for vote on partial hostage deal
NHL: Carey Price trade talks heat up as San Jose Sharks emerge as front-runners
description: Carey Price's future with Montreal Canadiens is uncertain. San Jose Sharks may acquire Price's contract. Canadiens want to relieve salary-cap issues. Sharks want to balance contracts and sign Michael Misa. Montreal may send Price and a draft pick to San Jose. Artem Guryev and Gannon Laroque may go to Montreal. Both teams have incentives to finalize the deal soon.

title: Vandharai vaazhavaikkum Chennai is not just a saying; it reflects city’s soul: Nina Reddy
Southern Railway’s move to hire retired loco pilots draws flak
description: Loco pilots, while organising protests at various railway stations, said while on one hand the recruitment of loco pilots was progressing at a slow pace, on the other hand, they themselves were suffering from denial of leave, and stress due to excess of work and continuous night duties

description: The government said that while the app is currently equipped to translate four languages – Gondi, Bhili, Mundari and Santali

title: Riding out American storm: Modi joins Putin in his limo; seeks early end to Ukraine conflict
description: Despite US pressure, India and Russia reaffirmed their strong ties at the SCO summit, with PM Modi and President Putin emphasizing their nations' enduring friendship and cooperation. Modi highlighted the importance of their partnership for global stability, while Putin noted the positive momentum in trade and economic relations.

title: Over 3 lakh acres of land hit by flood in Haryana; Faridabad on edge after release of excess water in Yamuna
description: Over 46,880 farmers in 1,003 villages have registered on the e-Kshatipurti portal for crop damage claims

description: According to the revised rules, a child will no longer be punished or miss classes for arriving late. Instead, the onus has been placed on parents, who may now face a fine for bringing their wards late to schoo

title: A man’s body was found near a lake in Rajkot. Police probe unearthed a brutal punishment for a ‘fraud’ worth Rs 90,000

Bengaluru City University to host Victor Hugo symposium and Literary Fest on September 3
Immigration bureau set to check fraud, deport foreigners
description: The Rules to govern the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025, notified by the MHA on Monday (September 1, 2025), allow for recording biometric data of foreigners and mandate educational institutions to inform the BOI about foreign students. Clubs and resorts can be shut down if frequented by illegal migrants or foreigners with criminal record

How rich is Bill Belichick? Breaking down his NFL career earnings
description: Bill Belichick, renowned for his NFL coaching success and six Super Bowl wins with the Patriots, boasts an estimated net worth of $70 million. His recent move to North Carolina involves a five-year contract worth $10 million annually, supplemented by endorsements and real estate investments across the country, solidifying his financial legacy.

description: According to the doctors, over 70 posts of assistant professors and senior residents in forensic medicine remain vacant. Even after 20 in-service doctors joining after October, many posts will remain unfilled, they add

The victim succumbed to her injuries in the hospital, leaving behind a young son. In a separate incident, a man was arrested for allegedly abetting his wife's suicide, following accusations of dowry harassment and infidelity.

Facing multiple FIRs, he was apprehended from a Kushinagar hotel after a manhunt. Police also seized spurious liquor from his brick kiln, initiating further legal action and investigating his associates.

As Army dismantles TMC’s Kolkata dharna stage over permission lapse, Mamata reaches spot, sees ‘Centre’s hand’
Army removes TMC stage: Mamata sees red; BJP says Bengal CM 'frustrated'
description: The Army dismantled a Trinamool Congress stage in Kolkata's Maidan, citing a violation of permit regulations regarding the duration of events in the area. Mamata Banerjee criticized the BJP, accusing them of using the Army, while urging the forces to remain neutral. TMC alleges political targeting and plans to relocate the protest.

title: PM Modi in China: Ties reset with Xi, carpool with Putin, message for Pak - 10 takeaways
description: Prime Minister Modi concluded his China visit, attending the SCO Summit and engaging in key bilateral meetings with Presidents Xi and Putin. Modi emphasized cooperation with China for global welfare and unity against terrorism, subtly criticizing Pakistan and China's BRI. The SCO condemned the Pahalgam attack, and Modi invited Putin to India for the annual summit, strengthening the strategic partnership.

title: Population collapse warning: Pakistani man warns Danish man; Elon Musk responds
description: Elon Musk has ignited debate by agreeing with a Pakistani man's claim about demographic shifts in Denmark, highlighting his ongoing concern about global population decline. Musk argues that declining birth rates pose a significant threat to civilization, potentially leading to economic stagnation and labor shortages. He has also warned about Japan's population decline, suggesting AI as a potential solution.

title: Shedeur Sanders’ private message to Deion after loss inspires
description: Colorado Buffaloes faced a narrow defeat against Georgia Tech. The defense struggled, giving up significant rushing yards. Coach Deion Sanders remained optimistic despite the setback. His son, Shedeur Sanders, sent a rallying cry to the family. He emphasized the need to regroup and uphold the Sanders legacy. Colorado prepares to face Nebraska next.

title: Apple & Samsung to Xiaomi: Stop using our phones; 'Cease and Desist' notice sent
description: Apple and Samsung have reportedly taken legal action against Xiaomi in India over advertisements that allegedly disparaged their products. The ads compared Xiaomi phones and TVs to those of Apple and Samsung, questioning their value and technology.

title: George Pickens: Micah Parsons’ Packers trade was ‘good for me’
description: In a stunning NFL trade, the Dallas Cowboys sent star edge rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers for two first-round picks and Kenny Clark. Parsons promptly signed a record-breaking $188 million extension with Green Bay, becoming the highest-paid non-quarterback.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Wang’s memo to staff makes one thing clear - all report to him
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: Jack Brady skips Gisele for special outing with mom Bridget Moynahan
description: Bridget Moynahan and her son Jack were spotted at the US Open, continuing their tradition at Arthur Ashe Stadium. This appearance followed Tom Brady's heartfelt social media tribute to Jack on his 18th birthday, highlighting their strong father-son bond. Despite Brady and Moynahan's past relationship, they maintain a respectful co-parenting dynamic, prioritizing their children's well-being.
